title: Blade of saeldor

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Blade of Saeldor is a magical sword that once belonged to Saeldor, an elite elven warrior, that can be created from an enhanced crystal weapon seed. Requiring level 80 Attack to wield, it provides the highest strength and slash bonus out of any weapon for its attack speed, surpassing the abyssal tentacle as the best slash weapon. It is tied for the strongest one-handed melee weapon in the game with the Ghrazi rapier and the Inquisitor's mace.

SMW Subobject for InactiveHigh Alchemy value: 3000000Buy limit: 8Examine: A magical elven sword.Is members only: trueIs variant of: Blade of saeldorImage: File:Blade of saeldor (inactive).pngUses infobox: ItemWeight: 1.814Value: 5000000Version anchor: InactiveRelease date: 25 July 2019Item ID: 23997

The Blade of Saeldor is a magical sword that once belonged to Saeldor, an elite elven warrior, that can be created from an enhanced crystal weapon seed. Requiring level 80 Attack to wield, it provides the highest strength and slash bonus out of any weapon for its attack speed, surpassing the abyssal tentacle as the best slash weapon. It is tied for the strongest one-handed melee weapon in the game with the Ghrazi rapier and the Inquisitor's mace.

Players can create the Blade of Saeldor via a singing bowl by combining 100 crystal shards and an enhanced crystal weapon seed. Doing so requires level 82 Smithing and Crafting to sing the crystal (the levels can be boosted), and grants 5,000 experience in both skills. If the player does not meet the Smithing and Crafting requirements, they can have Conwenna or Reese sing the crystal for them for an extra 50 crystal shards, for a total of 150.

If the player dies in PvP, the inactive blade is dropped, and all shards used to charge it will be lost. In PvM on the other hand, all current charges will be kept upon death.

  1. ^ Takes 5 ticks to create an entire inventory
  2. ^ Value based on the cost of obtaining by exchanging enhanced crystal teleport seeds with Amrod
  3. ^ Starts with 10,000 charges. Value is that of an inactive blade plus the cost of charging it. The tradeable inactive blade is worth 148,720,944.

Degradation[edit | edit source]

When created, the blade starts off at 10,000 charges and degrades like all crystal equipment, with one charge being depleted for each hit, whether it is a successful one or not; once the blade's charges have been fully depleted, it will become inactive and lose its stat bonuses until more charges are added to it. Wearing an elven signet will not provide the chance to not consume charges.

In order to add charges to the blade, crystal shards must be used on it (this can be done before it is inactive as well), with each shard granting 100 charges, up to a maximum of 20,000. Unlike other crystal equipment, players cannot directly revert the blade to an enhanced crystal weapon seed. In order to receive the seed back, players must bring an inactive blade to a singing bowl to revert it, costing 250 crystal shards. This is not recommended, as players can just sell the inactive blade on the Grand Exchange.

Using the shard value of making divine super combat potions, the cost per charge is 155.68. Using the shard cost of trading in enhanced crystal teleport seeds to Amrod, the most efficient option for buying crystal shards directly, the cost per charge is 226.42. As a comparison, the abyssal tentacle costs 230.39 per charge.

Upgrading[edit | edit source]

The blade can be upgraded by corrupting it, which requires bringing the blade and 1,000 crystal shards to a singing bowl. Doing so requires level 82 Smithing and Crafting (the levels can be boosted), and grants no experience. If the player does not meet the Smithing and Crafting requirements, they can have Conwenna or Reese sing the crystal for them for an extra 500 crystal shards. Excess charges in the blade will be taken into account; for example, a fully charged blade will only cost 800 crystal shards to corrupt. The corrupted blade stays charged permanently, and does not consume any crystal shards. While the infinite version is untradeable, it can be reverted to an uncharged state at any time, but the shards used will be permanently lost in doing so.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
11 May 2022
(update)

The blade of Saeldor now requires level 80 Attack to wield instead of level 75 Attack.

30 June 2021
(update)

The blade is no longer obtained from The Gauntlet; in its place, the enhanced crystal weapon seed is now dropped instead, and the blade is crafted from the seed.

8 April 2020
(update | poll)

The blade can now be made non-degradeable by bringing it and 1,000 crystal shards to a singing bowl.

22 August 2019
(update | poll)

The number of charges the Blade of Saeldor receives per crystal shard has been increased from 25 to 100, and the maximum charges possible has been increased from 2,500 to 20,000.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • In J.R.R. Tolkien's constructed elvish language, Sindarin, Saeldor means "wise brother".
  • In the Song of the Elves rewards poll, the Blade of Saeldor was proposed to have a special attack called Saeldor's Strike, which consumes 100% of the player's special attack energy and deals 50% additional damage, as well as knockback and stun the target like the dragon spear's special attack does. It only received 70.5% votes in favour, 4.5% short of passing the poll.

The '''Blade of Saeldor''' is a magical sword that once belonged to {{RSL|Saeldor}}, an elite elven warrior, that can be created from an [[enhanced crystal weapon seed]]. Requiring level 80 [[Attack]] to wield, it provides the highest strength and slash bonus out of any weapon for its [[attack speed]], surpassing the [[abyssal tentacle]] as the best [[slash weapon]]. It is tied for the strongest one-handed melee weapon in the game with the [[Ghrazi rapier]] and the [[Inquisitor's mace]].

Players can create the Blade of Saeldor via a [[singing bowl]] by combining 100 [[crystal shard]]s and an [[enhanced crystal weapon seed]]. Doing so requires level 82 [[Smithing]] and [[Crafting]] to [[crystal singing|sing]] the crystal (the levels can be [[Temporary skill boost|boosted]]), and grants 5,000 experience in both skills. If the player does not meet the Smithing and Crafting requirements, they can have [[Conwenna]] or [[Reese]] sing the crystal for them for an extra 50 crystal shards, for a total of 150.

If the player dies in [[Player killing|PvP]], the inactive blade is dropped, and all shards used to charge it will be lost. In [[PvM]] on the other hand, all current charges will be kept upon death.

==Degradation==
When created, the blade starts off at 10,000 charges and degrades like all [[crystal equipment]], with one charge being depleted for each hit, whether it is a successful one or not; once the blade's charges have been fully depleted, it will become inactive and lose its stat bonuses until more charges are added to it. Wearing an [[elven signet]] '''will not''' provide the chance to not consume charges.

In order to add charges to the blade, [[crystal shard]]s must be used on it (this can be done before it is inactive as well), with each shard granting 100 charges, up to a maximum of 20,000. Unlike other crystal equipment, players cannot directly revert the blade to an [[enhanced crystal weapon seed]]. In order to receive the seed back, players must bring an inactive blade to a [[singing bowl]] to revert it, costing 250 crystal shards. This is not recommended, as players can just sell the inactive blade on the [[Grand Exchange]].

Using the shard value of making [[divine super combat potion]]s, the cost per charge is {{Coins|({{GEP|Divine super combat potion(4)}}-{{GEP|Super combat potion(4)}})*0.025}}. Using the shard cost of trading in [[enhanced crystal teleport seed]]s to [[Amrod]], the most efficient option for buying crystal shards directly, the cost per charge is {{Coins|{{GEP|Enhanced_crystal_teleport_seed}}*0.00006666666}}. As a comparison, the [[abyssal tentacle]] costs {{Coins|{{GEP|Abyssal whip|0.0001}}}} per charge.

==Upgrading==
The blade can be upgraded by [[Blade of saeldor (c)|corrupting]] it, which requires bringing the blade and 1,000 [[crystal shard]]s to a [[singing bowl]]. Doing so requires level 82 [[Smithing]] and [[Crafting]] (the levels can be [[Temporary skill boost|boosted]]), and grants no experience. If the player does not meet the Smithing and Crafting requirements, they can have [[Conwenna]] or [[Reese]] sing the crystal for them for an extra 500 crystal shards. Excess charges in the blade will be taken into account; for example, a fully charged blade will only cost 800 crystal shards to corrupt. The corrupted blade stays charged permanently, and does not consume any [[Crystal shard|crystal shards]]. While the infinite version is untradeable, it can be reverted to an uncharged state at any time, but the shards used will be permanently lost in doing so.

==Trivia==
*In {{WP|J.R.R. Tolkien}}'s constructed elvish language, {{WP|Sindarin}}, ''Saeldor'' means "wise brother".
*In the [[Poll:Song of the Elves rewards|Song of the Elves rewards]] poll, the Blade of Saeldor was proposed to have a [[special attack]] called ''Saeldor's Strike'', which consumes 100% of the player's special attack energy and deals 50% additional damage, as well as knockback and stun the target like the [[dragon spear]]'s special attack does. It only received 70.5% votes in favour, 4.5% short of passing the poll.
